sub_title: Marketing Assistant Manager at Korea Trade Center Amsterdam
summary: Responsible for supporting South Korean SME clients to build business networks in the Netherlands. Passionate and interested in the global startup ecosystem.

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences
De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

awards.title: Holland Scholarship
awards.description: The Holland Scholarship is financed by the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science as well as Dutch universities. The scholarship is meant for international students from outside the European Economic Area (EU-countries, Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway) who want to do their bachelor degree programme in Holland.
awards.issuer: The Hague University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Online open market product registration and marketing support for Korean companies
projects.description:
A project to support Korean SMEs to enter the Dutch online open market(Bol.com). With partnering companies, provided administrative and communicative support for the 23 participating companies. Moreover, created an online open market(House of K) exclusively for Korean companies and products.

As the Project Lead, the main tasks were to:
►Manage overall project
►Layout project timeline
►Organize and facilitate an introductory webinar to explain the process of the project to Korean companies
►Manage communication between companies and partnering companies(Dutch online marketing agency and Dutch logistics company)
►Create internal and external reports

contributors.headline: Marketing Assistant Manager at Korea Trade Center Amsterdam

projects.title: Startup softlanding program
projects.description:
A project to introduce the Dutch startup ecosystem to various Korean startups. Collaborating with Amsterdam's local governmental organization, an accelerator, a legal and tax firm, and a Dutch startup with a Korean founder, delivered webinars and seminars to 20 Korean startups.

As the Project Manager, the main tasks were to:
►Plan and facilitate overall project
►Contact various local organizations to finalize the project details
►Hire a freelancer and provide a clear list of tasks
►Provide relevant assistance to participating Korean startups
►Create internal reports

*A Google Drive link with a series of recorded webinars and its contents can be provided upon request
*Refer to the additional links below to have an overview of the project
Dutch startup ecosystem introduction : https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6876473488811671553

Digital Softlanding Program_1 : https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6899633914910978048

Digital Softlanding Program_2 : https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6904736415309996032

contributors.headline: Marketing Assistant Manager at Korea Trade Center Amsterdam

profile_positions.description:
As the Marketing Assistant Manager, the main tasks are to:
►Search for prospective buyers and partners for Korean SME clients
►Build business relationships with and for Korean SME clients
►Lead the office's startup-related projects
►Plan and facilitate KOTRA Amsterdam's B2C project
►Collaborate with KOTRA HQ, KOTRA European HQ, and other governmental organizations
►Manage KOTRA Amsterdam's LinkedIn page
►Conduct research on various markets for both clients and KOTRA Amsterdam
profile_positions.title: Marketing Assistant Manager

profile_positions.description: Starting as an intern, continued the position as a Trainee
profile_positions.title: Government Program Executive

profile_positions.description:
As the Government Program Executive, the main tasks were to:
►Establish strong business relationships with different governmental organizations
►Speak to governmental key players within the tech ecosystem from all over the world
►Identify new business opportunities with governmental organizations
►Carry out intercultural communication and reach out to different cultures
►Organize events for governmental key players
►Work together cross-department and collaborate with multiple team members to grow the TNW X government program
profile_positions.title: Government Program Executive

profile_positions.description:
As the Communications Manager of UID, an NGO operating in the field of humanitarian migration, the main tasks were to:
►Manage overall external and internal communications
►Participate in the creation of the first "2-year report"
►Attend events and conferences, represent UID
►Use Social Media Tools to reach out to current and potential UID supporters
►Make and implement strategic development plans and strategies for communications
►Participate in the brand design during project launching and implementation
►Manage press opportunities – sponsorship opportunities, advertisements, and promotional materials etc
profile_positions.title: Communications Manager

company.name: The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: The Hague University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
As an Assitant Program Manager of the International Public Management programme's conference organizing group, the main tasks were to:
► Manage the Program Team of the Conference, "The Future Challenges of AI in Warfare"
► Assist the Program Team manager in managerial meetings
► Make weekly reports/updates for the stakeholders of the Conference
► Coordinate and communicate with other teams
► Contact keynote speakers and external organizations for the Conference
► Supervise the Conference on the Conference day
profile_positions.title: Assistant Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a part-time assistant in the Busan Port Authority's Europe headquarters located in the World Trade Center of Rotterdam, the main tasks were to:
► Analyze data
► Summarize and make reports
► Translate English documents into Korean documents 
► Assist headquarter manager in meetings with other organizations such as the Rotterdam Port Authority, Federatie Nederlandse Vakbeweging Havens, Antwerp Port Authority et cetera.
profile_positions.title: Parttime Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Being assigned to the Combined Forces Command after serving in the front line for 6 months as a Republic of Korea Marine Corps(ROKMC) marine, the main tasks were to:
► Translate English Documents into Korean Documents and vice versa
► Attend Republic of Korea - United States military training (war games) as a translator for the Naval Forces Command
► Assist commissioned officers of the Naval Forces Command (translating, scheduling, organizing events et cetera)
profile_positions.title: ROKMC English Translator
